About Me

Hi! I'm a junior at Stony Brook University majoring in Computer Science. I started programming during high school, and after attending several hackathons, I decided that I would pursue CS in college. Currently I'm studying operating systems, databases, and computer vision, and I would like to pursue research in computer vision for my honors thesis. I'm always trying to learn new things and improve myself. When I'm not coding I like to exercise or go on roadtrips. My favorite book would have to be "Cryptonomicon" by Neal Stephenson, but I also enjoy reading about finance. After graduating I would like to work in industry and maybe go to grad school.

Experience

Akamai Technologies
  • Software Engineer, Intern
  • June 2017 - Present

    • This summer I interned at Akamai Technologies in their Fort Lauderdale branch. I worked in the front end engineering team, developing new features and fixing bugs for customer-facing dashboard products. I mainly used AngularJS, and learned more about ES6 and Node.js during the internship.

    Featured Projects

    GPSApp
  • Java

    • A Java based desktop application that loads OpenStreetMap files and provides navigation information for user selected start and destination points. The app uses a mock GPS service that can show the application rerouting based on current location.

    Pexi
    • JavaScript
    • Microsoft Azure

    Pebble smart watch app that allows users to compare Uber and Yellow Cab fares in NYC and call a ride. Cab fares generated using Microsoft Azure Machine Learning API. Received FINRA sponsor prize at YHack 2015
